title: 110_hr470
content: CONTINUITY OF MEDICARE PRESCRIPTION DRUG COVERAGE FOR FULL-BENEFIT DUAL ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUALS. Continuation of Medicare coverage for certain prescriptions for full-benefit dual eligible individuals under Section 1860D-2(a) of the Social Security Act. Coverage must include certain drugs unless deemed medically unnecessary by a prescribing physician. The amendments made by subsection (a) regarding the coverage of certain drugs for full-benefit dual eligible individuals are effective as if included in the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003. The amendment allows Medicare to cover benzodiazepines under prescription drug coverage. Additionally, states are permitted to cover Medicare prescription drug copayments for full-benefit dual eligible individuals. The amendment allows states to provide medical assistance for Medicare prescription drug cost-sharing for full-benefit dual eligible individuals. The amendment to the Social Security Act allows for the inclusion of certain drugs and biological products under the definition of 'covered part D drug' even if prescribed for uses not included in their labeling. The amendment to the Social Security Act allows for the use of drugs and biological products for purposes not specified in their labeling, even if not listed in clinical reference compendia. Effective as of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003. Authorization for the Secretary of Health and Human Services to waive denial of prescription drug coverage. The amendment allows individuals to apply for a waiver from the Secretary to require prescription drug coverage after exhausting all other options under the Social Security Act. The waiver can be granted if the prescribing physician certifies the necessity of the drug. The amendment allows individuals to apply for a waiver from the Secretary for prescription drug coverage if deemed medically necessary by the prescribing physician. Effective for determinations made after the enactment of this Act.
